intro: Freycinetia palawanensis var. andersoniana, commonly known as the Palawan freycinetia, is a rare and endemic plant species found primarily in the Philippines. It belongs to the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its long, narrow leaves that are typically green with a waxy texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by edible, fleshy berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts to protect its natural environment.
